ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot of about stone tool technology and was familiarized with much of the contemporary literature and research on it
Knowledge on flintknapping and methodologies used in archaeology. Skills in flintknapping as well through various cool workshops!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The seminar was very engaging and it fostered great conversations with new insights
Wouldve liked more hands on identification and testing of fracture and material types

Strength - workshops on flintknapping and lab sessions! 
Weakness - none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: As long as you're aware that the "final project" is actually a 6,000 word research paper
Absolutely, I learned so much and the seminar style was engaging
Yes, for students with an interest in archaeology
Yes! It was a very beginner-friendly course yet highly interesting and engaging.
